Edited April 19, 2015 by NasaSpace101

Is that brownish color going to be on the finished product? It looks strange to me, especially compared to all the other solar panels having blue coloring. I know that the arrays are brown in real life, but it does ruin the stockalike feel.

The gold color is Kapton foil on the side opposite the cells. I wish all the panels had that look instead of drab grey.
The recent pictures are simply wonderful! Looking forward to seeing them in game!

http://web.archive.org/web/20140807172543/http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81537

Look at what I found...

Tanta!

Yeah, I know some people have been around for long enough to see the "Old Mod" download. But yeah, just for funsies.

Ah Good memories! Playing with Tantares since the first release. Bobcat's soyuz was a bit too real for me so I went on a forum exploration to find a stockalike one! And I found it here!

All this ISS showcasing has got me in a station-y mood, so I have began to revamp the Salyut parts a little, soon to be seen!

(No worries about saves, these parts will have exactly the same dimensions).

Maybe there will be some new space-station-y parts alongside revamps of the old ones, but no promises.

Putting off the PPTS and Kliper just a little bit, eh?

It's happening !!!!

What about doing separate MIR and Salyut parts, keeping nearly the same sizes, but with variant details and textures, having a big white can with " MNP " written in it would be perfect

( Always the same guy with the same white colours requests )

( Also, do you plan to do one or some new dishes for space stations like the ones we may see on this picture with orange and green yoghurt pot in the end of them ?

Ah, throwing us some crumbs?????????

cheers.

A couple of croutons. Pennies from heaven.

Noooo.. I was liking the brown texture. Could it be made available as an alt?

Unfortunately, it will be re-mapped UV-wise, so swapping out the original is a no-go.

That being said, something could be worked out, especially this upcoming DDS support would make alternate textures much easier (As easy as the TGA days).

Yup, and Leonardo PMM too, but no matter how much welding I was able to perform the station reached about 400 parts and as you may know it became a beautiful slideshow :s

Oh dear, I start hitting FPS troubles coming up to 1000+ parts, being limited to 400? My heart aches for you.

Hmmm, yeah this could be good. I think the later Salyut models, and MIR, had longer rear sections? Would be a nice alternate.

Colour schemes especially, I was planning to give this new Salyut a bit of striping (See Salyut 7), but not totally sure yet.

As for the "omni-greeble", the little bits I made for the LK were fun, so sure.

Hmmm, yeah this could be good. I think the later Salyut models, and MIR, had longer rear sections? Would be a nice alternate.

Colour schemes especially, I was planning to give this new Salyut a bit of striping (See Salyut 7), but not totally sure yet.

As for the "omni-greeble", the little bits I made for the LK were fun, so sure.

Salyut 7 and MIR rear section had more or less 1/4 of the original rear module size added, I noticed too that my salyut 6 / 7 looked a bit tiny for this reason. The colour stripes is a pretty good new to me who is in love with your station parts (give a try to the cream white/blue and red MNP of mir I am sure it would look great to match with your green tantares).

I am looking forward for your epic work as always .

Edited April 19, 2015 by spacecookie

Salyut 7 and MIR rear section had more or less 1/4 of the original rear module size added, I noticed too that my salyut 6 / 7 lookd a bit tiny for this reason. The colour stripes is a pretty good new to me who is in love with your station parts !

I am looking forward for your epic work as always .

A thought so! Yes, consider it confirmed as a new part then! (Though I would probably use the same IVA for both).

Although, I probably won't have "MNP" written, but probably something a little more generic.

Edit: A little birdie has informed me that the rear-section was actually a propulsion/fuel block, which is probably more suitable to be a separate part.

Edited April 19, 2015 by Beale

Edit: A little birdie has informed me that the rear-section was actually a propulsion/fuel block, which is probably more suitable to be a separate part.

Some kind of adapter with propulsion and enough space for the rear docking port would be really great.
